description.narrative: Project Outcome: Continued access to markets and financing. The Facility will continue to have a significant positive impact on the main stakeholder group, i.e. the Ukrainian farmers. It will allow farmers to benefit from (i) reliable access to global markets in order to sell their production, and (ii) a continued access to finance. In 2021, Kernel exported 8 million tons of grain from Ukraine (18% of the country's total grain exports) and it sourced approximately 5.5 million tons of grains from Ukrainain farmers. Kernel is providing pre-crop financing and pre-season forward contract programs to some of them, as well as support and education to make their farming activity more productive and efficient. Market Creation outcome: Integration. IFC expects the Facility, through the demonstration and replication channel, to contribute to the strengthening of financial integration of the grain value chain in Ukraine. This is essentially achieved by maintaining connections between several private sector financial institutions and grain farmers.

The proposed IFC investment is a participation of up to US$40m (the IFC Participation) in a US$200m senior secured borrowing base facility (the Facility) in favour of the Kernel Group (Kernel). Kernel is a leading agribusiness producer, processor and grain/seeds trader operating in Ukraine. The Facility has helped and will continue to help Kernel manage its grain value chain from production and storage in Ukraine to commercialization in multiple destinations.
